name: vscode-standard
description: Visual Studio Code extension for JavaScript Standard Style with automatic fixing.
author: Standard

standard.enable.description: Controls whether JavaScript Standard Style is enabled for JavaScript files or not.

standard.enableGlobally.description: Controls whether JavaScript Standard Style is enabled globally for JavaScript files or not.

standard.nodePath.description: A path added to NODE_PATH when resolving the standard module.

standard.options.description: The standard options object to provide args normally passed to JavaScript Standard Style when executed from a command line.

standard.engine.description: Controls whether VSCode should use an alternate Standard engine, like semistandard, standardx or ts-standard.

standard.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VSCode and the JavaScript Standard Style linter service.

standard.run.description: Run the linter on save (onSave) or on type (onType)

standard.autoFixOnSave.description: Turns auto fix on save on or off.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path start with this directory.

changeProcessCWD.description: Whether the process's cwd should be changed as well.

language.description: The language id to be validated by JavaScript Standard Style

autoFix.description: Whether auto fixes are provided for the language

standard.validate.description: An array of language ids which should be validated by JavaScript Standard Style

standard.usePackageJson.description: Activate JavaScript Standard Style based on project's package.json settings, use globally installed standard module if set to "false"

standard.treatErrorsAsWarnings.description: Any linting error reported by Standard will instead be displayed as a warning within VS Code.

commands.title: Enable JavaScript Standard Style for this Workspace
Disable JavaScript Standard Style for this Workspace

scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ..
scripts.lint: cd client && npm run lint && cd ../server && npm run lint && cd ..
scripts.format: cd client && npm run format && cd ../server && npm run format && cd ..
